alert.note: Alert for Big Island North; Kohala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 01 at 3:32PM HST until March 02 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING THROUGH 6 AM HST THURSDAY FOR KOHALA DISTRICTS OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...WIND ADVISORY THROUGH 6 AM HST THURSDAY FOR MAUI COUNTY OAHU KAUAI AND PARTS OF BIG ISLAND... .Robust high pressure far north of the state will continue to produce strong and gusty trade winds. Isolated pockets of warning level wind gusts are expected in the Kohala Districts of the Big Island, where a High Wind Warning remains in place through tonight. The Wind Advisory will likely be extended for portions of the state on Thursday. ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...East winds 30 to 45 mph with localized gusts over 60 mph. * WHERE...The northern portion of the Big Island, mainly in the North and South Kohala Districts. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines and damage roofs. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Strong winds may lead to property damage. Hazardous driving conditions due to powerful cross winds will pose a serious risk for drivers, especially for light weight and high profile vehicles. Loose outdoor items should be brought inside or secured properly.
